intro: Hieracium basidenticeps, commonly known as the broad-toothed hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are shorter than the central disk florets. Hieracium basidenticeps is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, thriving in temperate climates.
